title: Synthesis parameter effect detection using quantitative representations and high dimensional distribution distances. (arXiv:2304.01120v1 [cond-mat.mtrl-sci])
abstract: Detection of effects of the parameters of the synthetic process on the microstructure of materials is an important, yet elusive goal of materials science. We develop a method for detecting effects based on copula theory, high dimensional distribution distances, and permutational statistics to analyze a designed experiment synthesizing plutonium oxide from Pu(III) Oxalate. We detect effects of strike order and oxalic acid feed on the microstructure of the resulting plutonium oxide, which match the literature well. We also detect excess bivariate effects between the pairs of acid concentration, strike order and precipitation temperature.
context:
Title: Synthesis parameter effect detection using quantitative representations and high dimensional distribution distances. (arXiv:2304.01120v1 [cond-mat.mtrl-sci])
Abstract: Detection of effects of the parameters of the synthetic process on the microstructure of materials is an important, yet elusive goal of materials science. We develop a method for detecting effects based on copula theory, high dimensional distribution distances, and permutational statistics to analyze a designed experiment synthesizing plutonium oxide from Pu(III) Oxalate. We detect effects of strike order and oxalic acid feed on the microstructure of the resulting plutonium oxide, which match the literature well. We also detect excess bivariate effects between the pairs of acid concentration, strike order and precipitation temperature.
translated_title: 采用数量表示和高维度分布距离检测合成参数的影响
translated_abstract: 检测合成过程参数对材料微观结构的影响是材料科学中一个重要但难以捉摸的目标。我们开发了一种基于植被理论、高维分布距离和排列统计的方法，分析了一个合成氧化钚的设计实验中的参数效应，从而检测到冲压顺序和草酸酸度对生成的氧化钚微观结构的影响，这与文献相符。我们还检测到酸浓度、冲压顺序和沉淀温度之间的过度双变量效应。
tldr: 本论文基于copula理论，采用高维分布距离和排列统计方法研究一个设计实验中参数对材料微观结构的影响，发现了草酸酸度和冲压顺序对生成的氧化钚微观结构有影响，同时检测到过度的双变量效应。
en_tdlr: This paper develops a method for detecting the effects of synthetic process parameters on the microstructure of materials using copula theory, high dimensional distribution distances, and permutational statistics. The study conducted on the synthesis of plutonium oxide shows that strike order and oxalic acid feed affect the resulting microstructure and there are excess bivariate effects between pairs of acid concentration, strike order, and precipitation temperature.
